bioghist.p: Elwyn Allen Smith (b. 1916) received his B.D. from Yale Divinity School and his Th.M from Princeton Seminary. Smith served as a missionary in Philippines from 1945 to 1946. From 1945 to 1949 Smith was the Associate Youth Editor, Board of Christian Education. From 1950-1956, Smith was Dean and Professor of Church History, Dubuque Theological Seminary. He was Professor of Ecclesiastical History and History of Doctrine at Western Theological Seminary in Pittsburgh beginning in 1956. Smith is a former Professor of Theology and Vice-President at Temple University and was the coeditor of the Journal of Ecumenical Studies at Temple. Smith served as chair on the Task Force on the Middle East in the early 1970s.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Elwyn A. Smith. Materials include: manuscripts and published versions of articles by Smith, as well as background and research materials (including an Air Force training manual circa 1960); printed materials and newsletters from organizations with which Smith was affiliated or related to the topics of his historical research; reprints of articles by others and several dissertations; correspondence related to writing and professional activities; correspondence, minutes, reports, student papers, teaching notes, and a grade book related to Smith's work at Temple as a faculty member and administrator in the Religion Department, and as Vice President for Student Affairs; meeting minutes, correspondence, and papers related to the American Society of Church History; and family correspondence and photographs, as well as information about his children. The collection also includes correspondence, reports, drafts, policy statements, and printed materials related to the work of the Task Force on the Middle East, 1972-1974. Many newsletters and printed materials are from non-Presbyterian organizations, particularly Jewish organizations.
